section.heading: Usury defined.
section.text: If a person or corporation contracts in the District,

para.text: verbally, to pay a greater rate of interest than 6% per annum, or

in writing, to pay a greater rate than is permitted under section 28-3301, 28-3308, under Chapter 36 of this subtitle, or under § 26-301 et seq., the creditor shall forfeit the whole of the interest so contracted to be received.

section.aftertext: This section does not affect sections 26-901 to 26-912 .

annotations.annotation: Institutions of higher education, pleading usury as a defense, see § 28-3315.

Sections 26-901 to 26-912, referred to in the last paragraph of this section, refer to the Act of Feb. 4, 1913, as amended, and as translated to the 2001 edition. D.C. Law 18-378 amended and enacted into law Title 29.
